meanings.definition: A brief or trivial item of news or information.
meanings.sent1: The factoid about the new store opening spread quickly in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: I read an interesting factoid about penguins in the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The factoid about cats loving to chase laser pointers always makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: The factoid about elephants never forgetting is as well-known as the sun rising every day.
meanings.sent5: The factoid about bees communicating through dance is fascinating to learn about.

meanings.definition: Something that becomes accepted as a fact, although it may not be true.
meanings.sent1: The factoid that carrots improve night vision is a common misconception.
meanings.sent2: She shared a factoid about the dangers of swallowing gum.
meanings.sent3: The factoid that eating watermelon seeds will grow a watermelon in your stomach is just silly.
meanings.sent4: The factoid that lightning never strikes the same place twice is a myth that many believe.
meanings.sent5: The factoid that we only use 10% of our brains is a popular misconception debunked by scientists.
